page.title: 12A MAJOR HOSPITAL IN CRAWLEY
page.content: The hospital is large: 7 floors and {394 beds}of which 248 are generally occupied. There are{60000 outpatients. Patients come from Crawley and also from a wide area stretching to East Grinstead, Horsham, Reigate and Burgess Hill.{500}nurses and{90 doctors helped by{600}other staff work here. \ the medical staff are on duty. On average 6 babies are born and 2 people may die on any one day. Many different operations are done each day. Next year{expansion}will add a geriatric ward, a psychiatric ward and dayward. Services are becoming more centralised, e.g. maternity care. Out of 26 children only 7 said they had never been to hospital but several others had only been out-patients for stitches, fractures etc. Operations were for tonsils, adenoids, plastic surgery, eye and kidney problems.
